body:
I've done some testing with setting the `sampling.priority` tag.
It looks like Jaeger currently requires that tag to be present in **all** spans of a trace for the complete trace to be forcefully sampled. I.e. it is not enough to set the tag on one span (root span or a child span) and then have all the spans of that trace be automatically forcefully sampled. Related issue: https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-client-java/issues/465.

That means that the information, whether spans should be forcefully sampled, has to be given to all methods where new child spans get created.
EDIT: This information could be set in a baggage item of the `SpanContext` object already used as param for these methods.

In case there are a lot of traces being generated for a particular tenant, it would be a good feature to have an option to only force sampling of *error traces* for that particular tenant.

This could be implemented in these ways:
- A: Either with these attributes in the tenant json:
````
tracing-sampling-priority             [0|1|-1]    => optional, default -1 (i.e. use overall sampling strategy)
tracing-sampling-priority-applies-to  [all|error] => optional, default value could be "all"
````
- B: or with these:
````
tracing-sampling-priority-all     [0|1|-1]    => optional, default -1 (i.e. use overall sampling strategy)
 => sets the prio for all traces of the tenant
tracing-sampling-priority-error   [0|1|-1]    => optional, default -1 (i.e. use "-all" prio or overall sampling strategy)
 => sets the prio for error traces of the tenant, overriding the -all value
````

Option A would maybe look somewhat easier to the user (less permutations).
Option B would be more flexible and would allow these additional configurations:
- sample *only* error traces for the tenant, disable sampling of non-error traces (-all=0,-error=1)
- sample all tenant traces, *except* error traces (-all=1,-error=0)

I would opt for Option B, also because the common use case of only wanting to sample error traces would require only one option (tracing-sampling-priority-error).

I would like to keep the technical details of the tracing framework out of the tenant configuration, if possible.

A third option comes to mind which might be easier to understand for users:
`trace-level                   [default|error-only|all] `

Ok, right, having such names as values makes things clearer than having to use the integer values.

I only would rename the setting and add `none` and `default-all-errors` as possible values (and use `errors-only`):
`trace-sampling [default|default-all-errors|errors-only|all|none]`.
The `level` term isn't used in the OpenTracing context as far as I know, and might be confusing here.
I think with `error-only` I meant what you would call `default-all-errors` (which seems to be clearer). Based on that I do not think that we need `errors-only` and `none`.

Ok. I would suggest to start out with `trace-sampling-mode [default|all]`. Adding `default-all-errors` (and possibly `errors-only` and `none`) could be done later. 

More interesting is probably adding the possibility to force trace-sampling just for a specific *device* as well. This information should be held in the device registry's device information, imho.
That means that `trace-sampling-mode` can either be set for a tenant, or for just one device.

Concerning the implementation, it looks like we should keep a cache for this information.
The reason is, that there are already spans being created *before* the `trace-sampling-mode` information from the `TenantService` and the `RegistrationService` is retrieved. These spans would not get sampled.

issue.title: Refactor upload*Message() methods
issue.body:
This serves as a preparation for #896, for which the `getTenantConfiguration` invocation shall be put first in the `upload*Message()` methods of the protocol adapters.

Objective of this PR:
- reduce indentation levels
- reduce exit points of the methods, combining error handling and metric reporting

issue.title: [#896] Implement config option to force sampling of traces
issue.body:
Fix for #896. 

This introduces config options to enable forced sampling of traces (i.e. recording of traces in the tracing backend) for a specific tenant or device.

**Per tenant:**
In the Json structure returned by the Tenant API, a field `trace-sampling-mode` can be set with a value of "all" (meaning sampling of all traces is enforced) or "default".
````
  {
    "tenant-id": "DEFAULT_TENANT",
    "enabled": true,
    "trace-sampling-mode": "all"
  }
````

**Per device:**
In the Json structure returned by the Tenant API, a field `trace-sampling-mode-per-device` can be set with a map value where a field with the device id as name and a value of "all" (meaning sampling of all traces is enforced) or "default" is set.
````
  {
    "tenant-id": "DEFAULT_TENANT",
    "enabled": true,
    "trace-sampling-mode-per-device": {
      "4711": "all"
    }
  }
````

**Limitations:**
The sampling of traces can only be enforced by setting a "sampling-priority" tag on all spans that shall be sampled. That means that all spans created and finished *before* getting the tenant Json can not be taken into account here. For example, from all the spans created as part of uploading telemetry data in the HTTP protocol adapter:
````
hono-adapter-http: POST
  hono-adapter-http: authenticate device
    hono-adapter-http: get Credentials
      hono-service-device-registry: process request message
        hono-service-device-registry: get Credentials
    hono-adapter-http: validate Credentials
  hono-adapter-http: upload telemetry
    hono-adapter-http: get Tenant by ID
      hono-service-device-registry: process request message
        hono-service-device-registry: get Tenant
    hono-adapter-http: assert Device Registration
      hono-service-device-registry: process request message
        hono-service-device-registry: assert Device Registration
hono-adapter-http: forward Telemetry data
````
only these get forcefully sampled for now:
````
hono-adapter-http: POST
  hono-adapter-http: upload telemetry
    hono-adapter-http: assert Device Registration
      hono-service-device-registry: process request message
        hono-service-device-registry: assert Device Registration
hono-adapter-http: forward Telemetry data
````

**Scope:**
As part of this PR, the feature has been implemented for the HTTP, MQTT and AMQP adapters.

rename.from: Enable forced sampling of traces for a specific tenant
rename.to: Enable forced sampling of traces for a specific tenant (Http adapter)

issue.title: [#896] Implement trace sampling mode option in HTTP adapter
issue.body:
Fix for #896. 

This introduces config options to enable forced sampling of traces (i.e. recording of traces in the tracing backend) for a specific tenant or device.

**Per tenant:**
In the Json structure returned by the Tenant API, a field `trace-sampling-mode` can be set with a value of "all" (meaning sampling of all traces is enforced) or "default".
````
  {
    "tenant-id": "DEFAULT_TENANT",
    "enabled": true,
    "trace-sampling-mode": "all"
  }
````

**Per device (auth id):**
In the Json structure returned by the Tenant API, a field `trace-sampling-mode-per-auth-id` can be set with a map value where a field with a device auth id as name and a value of "all" (meaning sampling of all traces is enforced) or "default" is set.
````
  {
    "tenant-id": "DEFAULT_TENANT",
    "enabled": true,
    "trace-sampling-mode-per-auth-id": {
      "4711": "all"
    }
  }
````

**_EDIT:_**
Note: Since this PR, the JSON structure has been changed, see https://github.com/eclipse/hono/pull/1425#issuecomment-518192006.

issue.title: Enable forced sampling of traces for a specific tenant (MQTT adapter)
issue.body: The new config options introduced in #896 to enable forced sampling of traces (i.e. recording of traces in the tracing backend) for a specific tenant or auth-id should also be taken into account in the MQTT adapter.
